FuncDef:
The authening quota-out-redirect-enable command enables the function of redirecting a user to a specified domain when the quota of the user equal to zero.
The undo authening quota-out-redirect-enable command disables the function of redirecting a user to a specified domain when the quota of the user equal to zero.
By default, the function of redirecting a user to a specified domain when the quota of the user equal to zero is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the function of redirecting a user to a specified domain has been enabled, the device will redirect the user to the specified domain if the quota in the authentication Response packet received by the device is 0. This specified domain must have been configured. The user will get online from the specified domain and use the accounting scheme configured in the domain.
Precautions
The function to redirect a user to a specified domain when the quota of the user is used up (configured using the authening quota-out-redirect-enable command) is not supported for 802.1x users.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
